title: A keystroke level analysis of a graphics application: manual map digitizing
proctitle: CHI '94: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: Peter Haunold
authors.institution: Technical University Vienna, Department of Geoinformation, Gusshausstrasse 27-29/127.1, 1040 Vienna, Austria

authors.name: Werner Kuhn
authors.institution: Technical University Vienna, Department of Geoinformation, Gusshausstrasse 27-29/127.1, 1040 Vienna, Austria

references.text: Card, S.K., Moran, T.P., & Newell, A., The Keystroke-Level Model for User Performance Time with interactive Systems. ACM Communications, 23(7), 1980, pp. 396-410.
Card, S.K., Moran, T.P., & Newell, A., The Psychology of Human-Computer Interaction. Lawrence Erlbaum Associates, Hillsdale, New Jersey, 1983.
Frank, A.U., The use of Geographical Information Systems: The user interface is the system. In Medickij- Scott, D. & Hearnshaw, H. (eds.) Human Factors in GIS. Belhaven Press, London, 1993, pp. 3-14.

Gray, W.D., John, B.E., & Atwood, M.E., The precise of project Ernestine or an overview of a validation of GOMS. In Proceedings of A CM CHI'92 Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems, 1992, pp. 307-312.

Haunold, P. & Kuhn, W., A Keystroke Level Analysis of Manual Map Digitizing. In Frank, A.U. & Campari, I. (eds.)Spatial Information Theory." A Theoretical Basis for GIS. Springer Verlag, Heidelberg- Berlin, 1993, pp. 406-420.
Haunold, P., A keystroke level analysis of manual map digitizing (Masters Thesis, in German). Technical University Vienna, Dept. of Geoinformation, 1993.

John, B.E., Extensions of GOMS Analyses to Expert Performance Requiting Perception of Dynamic Visual and Auditory Information. in Proceedings of A CM CHI'90 Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems, 1990, pp. 107-115.
John, B.E. & Vera, A.H., A GOMS Analysis of a Graphic, Machine-Paced, Highly Interactive Task. In Proceedings of A CM CHI'92 Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems, 1992, pp. 251-258.
Kuhn, W., Editing Spatial Relations. In Proceedings of Fourth International Symposium on Spatial Data Handling (Zurich, Switzerland), 1990, pp. 423-432.
Maguire, D.J., Goodchild, M.F., & Rhind, D.W., (eds.) Geographical Information Systems: Principles and Applications. Longman Scientific & Technical, 1991.

Marble, D.F., Lauzon, J.P., & McGranaghan, M., Development of a Conceptual Model of the Manual Digitizing Process. In Proceedings of First international Symposium on Spatial Data Handing (Zurich, Switzerland), 1984, pp. 146-171.
Olson, J.R. & Nilsen, E., Analysis of the cognition involved in spreadsheet software interaction. Human- Computer Interaction, 3(4), 1988, pp. 309-350.
Olson, J.R. & Olson, G.M., The growth of cognitive modeling in human-computer interaction since GOMS. Human-Computer Interaction, 5(2&3), 1990, pp. 221- 265.
Singley, M.K. & Anderson, J.R., A Keystroke Analysis of Learning and Transfer in Text Editing. Human-Computer Interaction, 3(3), 1988, pp. 223- 274.
